author: mandrenguyen
body:
#### PR description:

The heavy-ion reconstruction (eras based on `pp_on_AA`) use track selection calibrations based on a BDT that was trained on Run 2 PbPb MC for six of the tracking iterations.
In the meantime, pp has migrated to a DNN-based track selection.  
There is an ongoing effort to perform a DNN training for heavy ions, but this is not 100% sure to converge for 13_2_X, which is the intended release for 2023 PbPb. 
As a back-up solution we have tested the default pp calibrations, but tightening the working points to give a similar efficiency to the old BDT calibrations.   
It was found that the efficiency and fake rate are very similar, except at high pT where the fake rate is dramatically lower with the DNN track selection. 
The performance is shown here:
https://indico.cern.ch/event/1278968/contributions/5372961/attachments/2646731/4581824/Performance_of_DNN_with_pp_training_in_heavy_ions.pdf
This PR switches to the DNN as the default for heavy ions.
We also remove an additional difference between pp and HI tracking, which was the use of the `tight` quality bit in the hit cleaning between steps. 


#### PR validation:

Tested with wf 160
